lead_paragraph: Lang Ping, who guided the United States women’s team to the silver medal in the Beijing Olympics, has decided not to extend her contract with the team. Lang, who as a player led China to a gold medal in the 1984 Los Angeles Games, said she was stepping down to spend more time with her family. The United States women were 90-94 over Lang’s four years with the team. The silver medal in Beijing was the team’s first appearance on the podium since 1992.
